abstracts.cdata!:
The Integrated Rural Water Supply and
            Environmental Sanitation Project for the state of Karnataka
            in India was devised with the following goals: 1)
            augmentation of water supply, including rehabilitation of
            existing sources and ground water recharging; 2)
            environmental sanitation with latrines, village drainage and
            solid waste disposal; and 3) conducting a base-line survey
            on a sample basis and devising suitable messages to educate
            people in villages about water-borne and water-related
            diseases as part of a health education program. This report
            contains the details of a socio-economic base-line survey
            conducted to understand the pre-implementation situation in
            project areas, and also to be used as a resource while
            assessing changes over a period of time.
